item.title: Lobsters Top Stories: Tuesday, October 29, 2024 at 6:20 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Jia Tanning Go code (54 points | 7 comments)
2. RTP: One protocol to rule them all (13 points | 27 comments)
3. Local web-based notes app inspired by "One Big Text File" with webpage downloads (17 points | 4 comments)
4. A free and open source map of the world, deployable as a single static file (18 points | 1 comment)
5. SQLite rsync: Database Remote-Copy Tool For SQLite (61 points | 8 comments)
6. We're forking Flutter. This is why (20 points | 2 comments)
7. Don’t Implement Unification by Recursion (24 points | 1 comment)
8. Bootloader Unlock Wall of Shame (37 points | 4 comments)
9. PEP 750 – Template Strings: lazy string formatting evaluation (19 points | 14 comments)
10. For Sale: Used Domain (**Clean Title**) (11 points | 8 comments)
11. Working with stacked branches in Git is easier with --update-refs (12 points | 1 comment)
12. What’s New in POSIX 2024 – XCU (56 points | 22 comments)
13. OpenZFS deduplication is good now and you shouldn't use it (53 points | 2 comments)
14. Operate Android Device on FreeBSD (4 points | no comments)
15. Using a CSS cursor to show the external link's favicon (8 points | 4 comments)
16. Elixir clustering on a Kamal+Hetzner deployment (6 points | no comments)
17. Specifying serializability in TLA+ (1 points | no comments)
18. Assembling a Game Boy Game with Meson (3 points | no comments)
19. A comparison of Rust’s borrow checker to the one in C# (42 points | 50 comments)
20. The parallel test bundle convention (5 points | 1 comment)
21. What are you doing this week? (6 points | 18 comments)
22. Trouble with Typed Racket? Try Contract Profile (3 points | no comments)
23. Mantis is a unified infrastructure as code framework that replaces Terraform and Helm (6 points | 6 comments)
24. Introducing zizmor: now you can have beautiful clean workflows (23 points | 1 comment)
25. An unexpected discovery: Automated reasoning often makes systems more efficient and easier to maintain (21 points | 11 comments)
